intro: Aganisia cyanea f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered aganisia, is a rare and striking plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its pale to white flowers, which contrast sharply with its dark green foliage. Its botanical features include small, elliptical leaves and a compact growth habit. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
